intro: Asterocephalus intermedius, commonly known as the intermediate starhead, is a rare and unique plant species native to the arid regions of southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its distinctive composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky soils and has a low, sprawling growth habit with small, narrow leaves. Its flowers are usually yellow or white, and they bloom in clusters, forming a star-like appearance that gives it its common name. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, Asterocephalus intermedius is considered a vulnerable species.
